noun.description: The carrying of a boat or its cargo between two navigable waters.
examples: the return journey was made much simpler by portage

verb.description: Carry (a boat or its cargo) between navigable waters.
examples: they are incapable of portaging a canoe
they would only run the rapid if they couldn't portage

proper noun.description: A port city in northwestern Indiana, on Lake Erie, east of Gary; population 36,976 (est. 2008).
A city in southwestern Michigan, south of Kalamazoo; population 46,133 (est. 2008).

origin: Late Middle English: from French, from porter carry. The sense relating to carrying between navigable waters dates from the late 17th century.
